interestingFact: Japan has more than 5 million vending machines, offering everything from drinks to umbrellas.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
India is the largest democracy in the world.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the last remaining Wonder of the Ancient World.
Russia spans 11 time zones, more than any other country.
France is the most visited country in the world.
China’s Great Wall is over 21,000 km long.
South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria, Bloemfontein, and Cape Town.
The U.S. has the world’s largest economy.
Chocolate originated in Mexico, created by the ancient Mayans.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country.
Saudi Arabia is the largest country in the world without a river.
Argentina is the birthplace of the tango dance.
Germany is home to the world’s largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world.
Iceland has no mosquitoes at all.
Switzerland has four national languages: German, French, Italian, and Romansh.
Kenya is famous for its wildlife safaris and is home to the Great Migration of wildebeests.
